titles.title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to extend the Federal Physicians Comparability Allowance Act of 1978, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Compensation and Employee Benefits.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Post Office and Civil Service. H. Rept. 103-242.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 133.

action.text: Ms. Norton moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 7/21/1993--Introduced. Amends the Federal Physicians Comparability Allowance Act of 1978 to extend the physicians comparability allowance program.
